page.title: 17POWLESLAND FARM
page.content: Powlesland Farm is owned by the Powlesland family.The farm house was built in 1240 and today they have 157 acres. We visited the farm to find out what sort of crops they grow and what stock they keep.We found out that they grow wheat,barley and grass to feed their stock.While the cereals are growing,the fields are sprayed with chemicals from a helicopter to prevent disease.When the crops are harvested the farmer uses tractors,trailers, combine harvesters and balers. This summer has been a bad year for cereals because it has been very wet so a blower was used to dry the grain.If the grain is not dried and it is stored wet,it will go mouldy and rot.Powlesland Farm produces this grain as feed for their herd of 150 calves.
